GRE not given, GPA 8.08/10 undergrad, MBA 8.47/10, 1 second author IEEE conference paper, 1 SCI first author journal paper, 4 months research internship in Europe.

Dear Aakash, 

Thank you for applying to the Rice University Computer Science graduate program for the Doctor of Philosophy degree.  Our graduate admissions committee has completed its review of applications, and it is with sincere regret we share that we are not able to offer you a position in our program.

This year our graduate program received a large number of applications for graduate study, and the applicant pool was extremely competitive. We were not able to accept a great many students who are extremely talented and would otherwise have made significant contributions to the Rice community. Please know that the decision was extremely difficult and is not a judgment of you, your abilities, or your many accomplishments.

While we regret that we were not able to offer you a place at Rice, we wholeheartedly wish you success in your educational pursuits and all future endeavors and extend our best wishes for the coming year.

Sincerely,

NO PAPER PUBLISHED, NO GRE, TOEFL 7.5

Area: Robotics

We regret to inform you that Rice University cannot offer you admission for graduate study.

A large number of factors played a role in arriving at this decision: the number of applicants, undergraduate records, GRE general scores, the interest of faculty, and the resources available. All of these factors were carefully considered, and this decision was only arrived at reluctantly.

The other members of the departmental graduate admissions committee join me in wishing you success in all of your future endeavors.
